name: Harting Down Wildlife Walk, Sussex West

ai.summary: Harting Down Wildlife Walk is an 11.7 km moderate hike through chalk downland and woodland in Sussex West, offering wide views of the South Downs and opportunities to spot local wildlife.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines grassy downs, chalk paths, hedgerows and short sections of woodland. Expect uneven footing, mild ascents and descents, and some stiles. Paths can be muddy after rain and may be exposed on open ridges with strong winds.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and bring layers; check the weather and daylight hours. Stay on public rights of way; heed livestock warnings on farmland; keep dogs under control. Carry a map or GPS, water, sun protection, and a snack. In icy or foggy conditions, reduce pace and stay on marked paths.
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn for wildlife activity and milder weather; summer for longer daylight; winter can be windy and muddy—plan accordingly.

seo.title: Harting Down Wildlife Walk – 11.7 km Moderate Hike in Sussex West, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Harting Down Wildlife Walk, an 11.7 km moderate hike in Sussex West, UK. Enjoy rolling downs, woodland, and wildlife with practical tips and gear.
